jot.math

Class GJK

  • java.lang.Object
    • jot.math.GJK

  • public class GJK
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that implements the Gilbert-Johnson-Keerthi algorithm for collision detection in 3D, as described in the video lecture at http://mollyrocket.com/849
    Author:
    G. Amador & A. Gomes

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean BodiesIntersect(java.util.ArrayList<org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D> shape1, java.util.ArrayList<org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D> shape2)
      Given the vertices (in any order) of two convex 3D bodies, calculates whether they intersect.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • BodiesIntersect

        public static boolean BodiesIntersect(java.util.ArrayList<org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D> shape1,
                                      java.util.ArrayList<org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D> shape2)
        Given the vertices (in any order) of two convex 3D bodies, calculates whether they intersect.
        Parameters:
        shape1 - convex 3D body.
        shape2 - convex 3D body.
        Returns:
        TRUE if two convex 3D bodies intersect, FALSE otherwise
